attributeList.attribute: Wellcome Trust Genome Campus, Hinxton, Cambridge, CB10 1SD, United Kingdom

names.fullName: FHY1 and FHL act together to mediate nuclear accumulation of the phytochrome A photoreceptor.

attributeList.attribute: Hiltbrunner A., Tscheuschler A., Viczian A., Kunkel T., Kircher S., Schafer E.

TAIR idetifiers were suplied in the text and were mapped using an index of TAIR identifyer to UniProt accession number supplied by Dr P Kersey. Prteins which did not have a TAIR accession number supplied were mapped using references in the text.

In vitro synthesised 35S-labelled phyA was incubated with phytochromobillin (PCB) to allow convalent conjugation of PCG to phyA. PhyA was then exposed to red light for 5 minutes , either followed by a far-red light pulse or not. The GST pulldown assay and detection of interacting proteins was then carried out.

names.fullName: FHY1 and FHL act together to mediate nuclear accumulation of the phytochrome A photoreceptor.

attributeList.attribute: Hiltbrunner A., Tscheuschler A., Viczian A., Kunkel T., Kircher S., Schafer E.

TAIR idetifiers were suplied in the text and were mapped using an index of TAIR identifyer to UniProt accession number supplied by Dr P Kersey. Prteins which did not have a TAIR accession number supplied were mapped using references in the text.

The study was carried out using selective plates supplemented ith phycocyanobilin (PCB) (20 micro molar). Plates were incubated under 1 mocro mol per meter squared per second red light or 13 micro mol per meter squared per second.

names.fullName: FHY1 and FHL act together to mediate nuclear accumulation of the phytochrome A photoreceptor.

attributeList.attribute: Hiltbrunner A., Tscheuschler A., Viczian A., Kunkel T., Kircher S., Schafer E.

TAIR idetifiers were suplied in the text and were mapped using an index of TAIR identifyer to UniProt accession number supplied by Dr P Kersey. Prteins which did not have a TAIR accession number supplied were mapped using references in the text.

The study was carried out using 3 day old etiolated mustard seedlings. After co-bombardment of the tissue with expression constructs, expressing epitope tagged proteins, the tissue was subjected to a white light pulse of 2 minutes and analysed by fluorescence microscopy.

names.fullName: Phytochrome-interacting factor 1 is a critical bHLH regulator of chlorophyll biosynthesis.

attributeList.attribute: Huq E., Al-Sady B., Hudson M., Kim C., Apel K., Quail PH.

names.fullName: PIF4, a phytochrome-interacting bHLH factor, functions as a negative regulator of phytochrome B signaling in Arabidopsis.
Nuclear accumulation of the phytochrome A photoreceptor requires FHY1.

attributeList.attribute: Hiltbrunner A., Viczian A., Bury E., Tscheuschler A., Kircher S., Toth R., Honsberger A., Nagy F., Fankhauser C., Schafer E.

In vitro synthesized 35S-labeled phyA was incubated with phycocynabilin (PCB) to allow the covalent conjugation of PCB to phyA. phyA was then exposed to red light for 5 min, either followed by a 5 min far-red pulse (IVT phyA Pr) or not (IVT phyA Pfr). GST pulldown and detectin were carried out using standard techniques.

names.fullName: PKS1, a substrate phosphorylated by phytochrome that modulates light signaling in Arabidopsis.

attributeList.attribute: For experiments testing the interaction of PIF3 and / or HFR1 with biologically active or inactive forms of the photoreceptor the phororeceptor proteins were in vitro translated and then mixed with chropmophore and treated to Red or Far Red light to produce Pr or Pfr forms of the photoreceptor.

attributeList.attribute: A cDNA library from 1 week old light grown arabidopsis seedlings (ecotype Columbia) was used in this yeast two hybrid assay.
Choi G., Yi H., Lee J., Kwon YK., Soh MS., Shin B., Luka Z., Hahn TR., Song PS.
FHL prefentially interacted with the red-light activated (Pfr) form of phyA.
The proteins interscted in a light dependent manner , treatment with far red light induced interaction.

The region specified as the phyA binding region of FHY1 in the text is amino acid residues 167-202 and is described as the C-termini of the FHY1 protein. However the UniProt entry is 313 amino acids in length , therefore their is a discrepency between definitions of the C-terminal domain between the report and UniProt entry.
The proteins colocalised to the nucleus
